translation.variant: The equipment library is the wrong version.
Go to the Engineering tab and look under the EquipmentBuilder topic.
The file you selected is NOT a valid equipment file!

translation.note: Tooltip to explain that this field automatically formats the value into a safe or 'legal' format..
translation.variant: This field is automatically formatted into a 'legal' equipment file name.

translation.note: Tooltip to explain that this button gives you context sensitive help.
Tooltip to explain that this button deletes the associated option.
translation.variant: Delete this item from the application.
Error setting the default system for {0}. The local.properties file is read-only.\nPlease remove the read-only attribute from the file and try again.

translation.note: Automated Logic company name.
Carrier company name.
Label to explain that the admin pasword is four numbers.
This refers to the English or 'Imperial' measurement system, not to the english language (i.e. ounces vs milliliters )
Table header. Abbreviate for 'Analog Input'
Table header. Abbreviate for 'Analog Output'
Table header. Abbreviate for 'Binary Input'
Table header. Abbreviate for 'Binary Output'
Table header. Abbreviate for 'Analog Value'
Table header. Abbreviate for 'Binary Value'
Table header. Abbreviate for 'Schedule'
Label to denote the total number of AI elements in a table.
Label to denote the total number of BI elements in a table.
Label to denote the total number of AV elements in a table.
Label to denote the total number of Alarms in a table.
Label to denote the total number of Loop elements in a table.
Label to denote the total number of Schedule elements in a table.
Label to denote the total number of Hardware elements in a table.
Label to denote the total number of AO elements in a table.
Label to denote the total number of BO elements in a table.
Label to denote the total number of BV elements in a table.
Label to denote the total number of Trends in a table.
Label to denote the total number of Graphic elements in a table.
Label to denote the total number of Software elements in a table.
Label to denote the section of the user interface that displays totals values
Dialog title. ZN is the abbreviation for 'Zone'
Message displayed in a dialog. ZN is the abbreviation for 'Zone'
translation.variant: The application has options selected that violate the ZN zone rules. It can still be tagged for use in a ZN module but it will lose this tagging if edited after download. Do you want to keep the ZN tagging?

translation.note: Button text. The button removes the zone 'tagging' (i.e. the item is no longer marked or flagged as being 'ZN' or zone.)
Message dialog title, capitalized for emphasis

translation.variant: The library file used to create this equipment could not be found. The next closest match was loaded instead. Some descrepancies may occur.
The created equipment has errors and will not compile. These errors are usually caused by incorrectly entered data. If you are unable to resolve these problems please contact technical support.

translation.note: General error message given when we fail to load the information for an option from the equipment.
translation.variant: We are unable to load the information for this element.

translation.note: This is a sentence fragment that should read something like 'Automatically selected because 'option1' in category 'category2' is selected.
This is a sentence fragment that should read something like 'Automatically selected because 'option1' in category 'category2' is selected.
This is a sentence fragment that should read something like 'Automatically selected because 'option1' in category 'category2' is selected.

translation.variant: This value cannot be left empty.
Gray text indicates options that can conflict with currently selected values.
Blue text indicates options which do not meet ZN rules. Further editing will cause ZN tagging to be lost.
This value can contain only digits and a single decimal point to be a valid number.
This value can contain only letters, numbers, or the characters _ - #.
This value can contain only letters, numbers, or the characters _ - #. And it cannot start with a number.
This value must be between 1 and {0} characters long.
Reference Base values cannot contain duplicates.
Equipment names longer than {0} characters will be truncated when used in file names.
Click a link below to open the file.

translation.note: Message warning the customer to take a look at the generated control program to ensure it is valid before using it.
translation.variant: The files generated by this software should be carefully evaluated before use.
Select the file(s) you want to generate.
Select where to save the files.

translation.note: Button label for button to start over creating an equipment from the beginning of the process
Tool tip to explain the function of the restart button
translation.variant: Go back to the beginning and create/open an application.
File(s) exist with the given name. Overwrite?

translation.note: Provides definitions for the abbreviations found in the 'restriction-level-column-header' column.

translation.variant: R = Restricted. Do not mix with other Restricted or Special type applications in the same controller.
CR = Conditionally Restricted. Some options will make this a Restricted application.
S-XX = Special Type. Do not mix with Restricted applications or with another Special application with the same "XX" Type Code.

translation.note: Menu item that starts the EquipmentBuilder (one word cannot be translated).

translation.variant: Automatically save generated files to archive?
Prompt for Device ID during each download?
Device ID scheme currently in use:
No valid libraries found in directory
Some program functions have been disabled.
Equipment is required to download. Please specify an Equipment file.
Driver is required to download. Please specify a driver.
Please choose a valid xml file before attempting to download.
The xml is not in the correct format or contains invalid content
Unable to select ICE with reference name {0}. ICE does not exist."

ERROR: Unable to save {0} to archive directory
Use auto-assign with override deviceID base
Use auto-assign with database deviceID base
Use auto-assign with current deviceID base
Module not responding. Check comm port settings and physical connection to module.
Error: unable to write download data to log

translation.note: Common abbreviation for "Not Applicable".

translation.variant: The server is still running. Exit anyway?
The system already exists, overwrite it?

translation.note: This is used to let the user know that there were differences in a specific file within a zip file they are importing and a file on the disk.
translation.variant: The following file(s) have been changed and must be imported manually:
Internet Explorer Could Not Be Found
Please enter the location of Internet Explorer or click 'Browse' to choose.
Stop the system before performing this action.
Create or select a system before trying to start it.
Your license will expire in {0} days. Please contact your {1} Representative for an updated version.
If your port is not listed, relaunch this application with USB-L connected.
This permission key does not apply to the current license
Copies the license information to the clipboard. This information is needed to create a permissions key for this license.
